Function Documentation

bool checkSumForSentence ( char *  sentence)

This function checks the checksum for a sentence from the GPS sensor.

Parameters:
sentenceThe sentece to be checked.
Returns:
true if checksum succeeded, false otherwise.
bool isSentence ( char *  sentence)

Check the first two characters match those of a valid Garmin GPS sentence.

int parseGPS ( char *  buf,
double &  lat,
double &  lng,
double &  heading,
double &  speed 
)

A handwritten parser for various GPS output protocols, allowing for arbitrary mid-line breaks. The latitude, longitude, heading, and speed info will be extracted from the lines in the buffer.

Parameters:
bufThe buffer contains GPS info from the sensor.
int parseLL ( char *  sentence,
double &  lat,
double &  lng,
double &  heading,
double &  speed 
)

Gets a sentence from GPS sensor and parse it accordingly to set the lat, lng, heading, and speed and generates appropriate messages for satellites infomation.

Parameters:
sentenceThe sentence to be parsed.
latThe latitude to be set.
lngThe longitude to be set.
headingThe heading to be set.
speedThe speed to be set.

Reset all the GPS error flags.
